title: London to host FIFA Women Champions Cup tickets on sale
body_text:
The first-ever FIFA Women’s Champions Cup is heading to London — and tickets are now on sale.
Taking place from January 28 to February 1, 2026, the closing matches of the inaugural Women's Champions Cup will unfold across two London venues.
The highly anticipated semi-finals are confirmed with Arsenal set to face off against ASFAR at 6pm on January 28, while Gotham FC and Corinthians will lock horns earlier in the day at 12.30pm.
Both encounters will take place at Brentford Stadium.
Elsewhere, the final fixtures of the tournament will be played with the third place play-off and final both being played at Arsenal Stadium on Sunday, 1 February.
The tournament aims to shine the spotlight on the "highest level of women’s club football" as fans prepare to witness four "unmissable" matches laid out for the final stages.
The semi-final participants swiftly rose through continental championships, creating a thrilling line-up of teams from the US, Brazil, England, and Morocco.
After a notable win on home soil against Wuhan Jiangda WFC, ASFAR (AS Forces Armées Royales Féminine) has geared themselves up for the intercontinental showdown.
Additional stakes ride high as the final is set to determine the very first women’s intercontinental club champions.
Spectators will be able to scoop up tickets for both particular matches of the semi-finals, with prices ranging from £5 for juniors to £20 for adults.
As for the final and the third-place tie, one ticket covers entry for both games.
These are priced from £10 for juniors to £60 for adults for the highest category of seats.
Interested spectators can secure their spot for the high-stakes matches directly through FIFA's official website at FIFA.com/tickets.
The competition signifies a competitive battlefield filled with world-renowned teams.
Fans can witness an epic confrontation between reigning UEFA Women's Champions League holders Arsenal and ASFAR, the CAF Women’s Champions League 2025 champions.
Gotham FC, Concacaf champions from the US, will testify their grit against Brazilian champions Corinthians, the CONMEBOL champions.
The matches are not just about competition — the Women’s Champions Cup serves a larger purpose.
The tournament, given the green light by the FIFA Council in May 2024, is held during years when the FIFA Women’s Club World Cup is not scheduled.
It forms part of FIFA’s broader initiative to bolster shared engagement with women’s football and enhance its visibility around the globe.
In the heart of London, these world-class athletes will answer their respective countries' call in an attempt to claim the revered title of the first FIFA Women’s Champions Cup winners.
Fans are expected to fill the stands to witness history unfold right before their eyes, and tickets for this unmissable football event are already available to purchase.
